Because the arrow is referring to the electric field, for a negative charge, the arrow is always pointing towards it and for a positive charge it’s pointing away from it (distance. So if the given is -4 Columbs that means force has to be antiparallel (in this case the left) since distance is towards the right

@seamusmoran4776  Swear I already replied to you, but in case I didn't. Yes I did good, got a B+ in Physics 1-3 (Kinematics, E&M, then Thermo & Waves respectively). I find being able to see the principles in every day objects to be the most helpful cause I allowed me to see the applications and envision problems better in my head. My professors always made sure to bring props and demonstrations to lecture to introduce new topics and sometimes used those objects to derive the equations in front of us. Very insightful. Plenty of YouTube videos on all types of Physics topics, you just need to know what you're looking for first (which isn't always easy lol).

i think the first calculation was for excess protons (derived from +100uC), and so if given total electrons that means THAT amount of protons helped to neutralise it, and so add the excess + neutralising protons= total protons. This just my interpretation tho haha i dont study physics

since +100 uC object signifies that there is much more protons than electrons, he converted it into proton to determine the excess protons on a that object which is 6.25x10^14 protons. The magnitude he give 1.5x10^14 electrons is also containing protons because it is from the same object +100 uC. Therefore, to find the overall protons on that object, we need to add 1.5x10^14 electrons and protons, to the execess protons  6.25x10^14. :))

One proton cancels one electron. And you have a positive charge due to excess protons. Therefore the amount of protons that canceled with the electrons plus the excess protons, are the total amount of protons.

@mahaasreighosh8577  until now the last class used to learn doppler effect and emphasise more on mechanical waves but now they changed the physics curriculum and dobbler effect is now replaced with magnetism also you learn the bernuli equation in the 2nd or final class of highschool

@mrhatman675  i see, this stuff is taught in high school in India. But in USA, physics 2 is an introductory class (even biology majors have to take it) and then they have the more specialized classes for physics majors like quantum mechanics and fluid dynamics, where you'd learn about Bernoulli's principle. Electromagnetism is taught in my school for physics too tho :P

@mahaasreighosh8577  I think my school system ads things like bernouli s equation or waves because they want students if they ever become physisists to have a small experience from everytype of physics so they can decide which kind of physics they like better

@mahaasreighosh8577  even though university students also do classical mechanics but more advanced with fake forces like the centrifugal force and cariolis effect but note that this is the curriculum you would do if you study ELECTRICAL ENGEENIERING if you go mechanical engeeniering I think you would do aerodynamics
